user_request: see creations saved in the google photos
screen_desc: The screenshot displays the "Settings" menu of a smartphone, specifically related to the "Backup & sync" section. It shows the email address used for backup and offers options like "Free up device storage," notifications settings, and adjusting assistant cards. There's also a "Sharing" section to remove video from motion photos and geo-location data from shared content. Additionally, Google Drive sync settings and Google Location settings are available to manage photos and videos across Google services.
history_actions: click on the Photos app located at the upper left.
click on the "Confirm" button located at the bottom of screen.
click on the menu icon (often represented by three horizontal lines, also known as the "hamburger" icon) located at the top left.
click on the "Settings" located at the middle left.

think_action.Thought: The user has requested to see creations saved in Google Photos. Since we are currently in the Settings menu of the Photos app, and the 'Back up & sync' section is visible, the next logical step is to return to the main Google Photos view where the creations are displayed. The next action will be to navigate out of this settings screen and into the main photos view.
Future Action Plan: Navigate back to the main Google Photos screen where the saved creations are visible.
Ensure the user is in the correct section of Google Photos to view their creations.
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Navigate back to the main Google Photos screen.
